text: The A1 is an autoroute (motorway) in France. It is the busiest autoroute in Europe. Over 180,000 vehicles use it every day, including over 63,000 lorries. It connects Paris and Lille. It also passes next to Paris' Charles de Gaulle airport. The autoroute is long. It is the main road linking Paris to Belgium and the Netherlands. The A26 autoroute joins the A1 autoroute near Arras. This also makes the A1 a link to Calais and England.A1 autoroute data and images ==Exits and junctions== Exit/Junction Destination 1 Boulevard Péripherique Saint-Denis Sarcelles, Amiens via and Stains, Garges-lès-Gonesse La Courneuve , Nanterre Le Blanc-Mesnil , Aéroport CDG, Senlis via Chantilly Parc Astérix Senlis, Creil, Meaux Pont-Sainte-Maxence Compiègne, Beauvais Montdidier Amiens, Roye Saint-Quentin Albert, Péronne Bapaume Arras Douai, Arras via Hénin-Beaumont Lens Plate-forme multimodale de Dourges Carvin Seclin Aéroport de Lille-Lesquin Lille ==References== A01
title: A1 autoroute
